intro: Unona merrittii, commonly known as the Merritt's thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub with spiny, hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and they bloom in late summer to early fall. Unona merrittii is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with deep root systems and water-storing tissues.
